data.title: “Had To Sign a Contract”: $450 Million Worth Arnold Schwarzenegger Once Made a Bizarre Deal to Keep His Supervillain Costume, Revealed in 2015
data.meta_description: British film producer Peter MacGregor-Scott once revealed the lengths Arnold Schwarzenegger went to keep his Mr. Freeze costume.
data.text:
More often than not, it is a common occurrence that actors like to take souvenirs to keep them as a memory. Such souvenirs translate into the time spent at a particular set while filming for a specific scene or movie. Whether it is Daniel Radcliffe taking home the Harry Potter glasses or Ryan Reynolds keeping his Deadpool costume, it is only natural for actors to confide in a souvenir to treasure their emotions somewhere. Legendary bodybuilder-turned-actor Arnold Schwarzenegger is no different.

One of his movie producers once revealed that Arnold Schwarzenegger made a peculiar deal to hold on to one of his costumes. As Schwarzenegger was not allowed to take it home forever, he decided it rent it instead. But which one of his costumes was it? Is it from his iconic movie Terminator, or something else?

Arnold Schwarzenegger struck a deal for a costume

In June 2015, British film producer Peter MacGregor-Scott appeared in an interview with the Hollywood Reporters. Herein, while talking about the movie, Batman & Robin, McGregor-Scott revealed how Arnold Schwarzenegger wanted to take Mr. Freeze’s costume from the set. However, when he couldn’t convince the management to let him have it, he struck a deal to rent it instead.

Explaining the ordeal to Hollywood Reporters, Peter MacGregor-Scott said, “Arnold Schwarzenegger wanted a costume of Mr. Freeze. It went all the way up to the top of the studio. He had to sign a contract, and I think he pays $1 per year to borrow the costume. The lights in those costumes last 9,000 hours. He doesn’t have them on all day long, but he does turn them on quite frequently.”

While no one else was allowed to take something from the set, the villain of the movie eventually got what he wanted. This isn’t the only instance related to this movie when the management seemed to have favored Schwarzenegger more than the rest.
